comments.body: What would happen to sandbox listing if more than two containers have the same name (but different random suffixes)? We should make sure we return the latest one.

If previous container is shown in `docker ps`, we will create container with increased attempt.
If previous container is not shown in `docker ps`, we will randomize the container name again anyway.
Assume we have two containers `abc_randomstr1` and `abc_randomstr2`. Which one would `ListSandboxes` return?

I mean that according to the current logic, there is no way that kubelet will create 2 containers with the same name but different suffixes. Just like we are sure that kubelet will not create 2 containers with the same attempt (if there is no such name conflict bug).
But we can add the check to make less assumption on kubelet.

I agree that this should not happen. Just wanted to know what the behavior would be in case it happens due to buggy code. I think kubelet sorts the containers by creation timestamp and go through the latest one first, so this should not be an issue anyway.

If there are really 2 containers `abc_randomstr1` and `abc_randomstr2`. Both of them will be returned by list functions.

This will cause 2 containers with the same `Attempt` but different `ID`s being returned. This seems fine, because we mainly rely on container id and don't use `Attempt` that much.

This will lead to:
* Wrong restart count. 
* Newer container can't create log path.
From user's view, only latest container is shown. So I think here should not be a problem.
nit: also checks whether the first part is equal to kubePrefix here.
nit: also checks whether the first part is equal to kubePrefix here.
